body:
Comment 1: 
Relevant thread: https://groups.google.com/d/topic/golang-nuts/G00zLFKg8-E/discussion

It's interesting that the current (gc) behavior is actually useful, to some extent, even
though looking weird. Consider:

        var f []interface{}
        var u []t
        var i int
        // ...
        for i, f[i] = range u {}

So it might be worth of a thought to have it, maybe, specified this way.

Anyway, IIUC the report then the behavior differs between gc and gccgo which is not
acceptable, I believe.
